reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was a visit planned nearly 2 years in advance and it didn't disappoint. Just prior to travelling down I read some of the recent reviews. I didn't come across any staff who were anything other than delightful and professional. We were made very welcome. The food on both nights was excellent and the service good. It was wonderful to have the opportunity to dress for dinner, especially on the Saturday (dance night). No TV, no mobile signal and no internet - wonderful. The views and scenery are spectacular. It's somewhere everyone should visit, if they can, at least once in their life. And, if brave enough, take a dip in the outside natural tidal pool!
reviews.title: A reason to dress to the nines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have visited Bigbury on Sea often over the last 15 years with my two daughters who were very young at the time and have always been curious about the hotel on the Island which has featured in various TV programmes. We visited Bigbury again this September and my partner surprised me with a Sunday lunch reservation on the11th. We both felt we were made to feel special straight away - we found Gary -(I think Irish) bar man friendly, funny and patient as I couldn't make up my mind what to drink. Also waitress (didn't catch name but my partner thought she may be French) again very attentive and friendly. For the first 15minutes I was overwhelmed as the atmosphere of the hotel is different to anything I have experienced. You are certainly not rushed and my partner had to reassure me that we were there for the afternoon and to relax, take in the picturesque views, the decor etc. After calming down we wandered around the grounds. The views from the hotel are stunning. I have an interest in the Art Deco era so I felt the hotel didn't disappoint - very unique and I felt confident to mooch around. We were given time without hassle to choose from the menu which I found hard - the choice was excellent. The table we were given was superb - the view was fantastic. When our food arrived it looked good and was of excellent quality. My only doubt was my partner was thinking the portion size was too small but the complete opposite - he did not ask for anymore food all day - looks are deceiving! For us the visit was for no special occasion apart from my partner wanted to treat me and cure my curiosity and the hotel definitely lived up its reputation. We have agreed we will definitely visit hotel again and maybe be book a room for the whole experience that the Burgh Island Hotel has to offer.
reviews.title: Sunday Lunch at Burgh Island Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband surprised me with a stay at Burgh Island Hotel for my 50th. I love Art Deco and was not disappointed with the hotel and grounds. Because of the authenticity of the hotel the frayed edges can be overlooked. We are seasoned travellers and must say that the location is undeniably one of the best we have been in. We stayed in the Beach house with stunning views over the bay but had it not been a surprise I would have preferred to stay in the main hotel as I found the beach house very over priced. The views were exceptional but not for the price! The bed was too small and as the beach house decor was not authentic there is no reason why a king size could not replace the double. Unfortunately we felt cramped and did not sleep well.
reviews.title: A step back in time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However waking up to the sound of the sea and the amazing views was incredible. For the price of the beach house we would have appreciated some fruit and perhaps sparkling water or even a small bottle of wine as a welcome and even a note of welcome..... something to reflect the tarriff. Even the most basic of hotels offer biscuits with their tea and coffee. The coffee and tea were in cannisters and there was no choice or selection. Once again did not reflect the tarriff. Talking about "little extras" we arrived after a long journey from London and a welcome drink at Reception would have been appreciated (it did not have to be alcoholic). Many hotels with these tarriffs offer a fruit cocktail and a hot towel whilst you sign in. We were asked by a member of staff if it was a special occasion and when I said it was for my 50th I thought they would have offered a small gift. We have stayed in hotels around the world on many special occasions and have had toiletries wrapped as a gift, a bottle of champagne and fruit, small hand wrapped chocolates..... These are the little touches that sets hotel hospitality above the rest... especially when prices are high.
reviews.title: Stay more than 2 nights and you'll get the same old menu from 2 nights before!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cocktails and canapes in the lounge before dinner were lovely. The service good and the barman mixed the cocktails perfectly. The music was a perfect choice and the ambience was wonderful. We enjoyed dressing for dinner and the meals on both nights were exceptional. The lamb on the first night and the beef on the second were the most tender and tastiest we have every had. The service on the whole was good apart from one waitress pouring my husband's water across my plate.
reviews.title: perfect time cant wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went for 'significant' birthday weekend and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The position speaks for itself and the decor and style of the hotel was beautiful. The room was lovely, people have mentioned cracked windows etc, but you have to view this as somewhat of a period piece retaining originality. The food was superb both in terms of quality and presentation, and in the most part very well served (when there were significant delays with a sandwich at lunchtime, this was addressed with a free glass of wine which shows good customer service).
reviews.title: Unique location and lovely food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of negatives, not many as it was an extremely pleasurable stay, most of the staff were superb - very helpful and friendly apart from an experience with the receptionist 'Hugh'. There is little detail about dress code on non-dinner dance nights and when i asked i got a closed eye shudder and told the MIMIMUM was suit and tie, and somehow we expected to know that we didnt need to book a time for dinner. We also wanted to open a bottle of champagne i had been bought in the room and asked for an ice bucket. My wife got what felt like a telling off on the phone being told that she hoped she realised she would be charged £15 corkage if he delivered an ice bucket. The 'you should be privileged to be here' attitude wasnt displayed by the other staff luckily.
reviews.title: What a place....when can I return....1st choice it's booked!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only other minor points are that i would imagine that the room would be cold in the winter - electric radiatiors and none of the windows would shut totally (this is a tricky one as keeping the windows retains some of the original charm of the building) and the fact that tables are supposed to be available for guests at the Pilchard, yet it was fully booked when we tried to get in on the friday night. Some negative points at the start, but overall a very nice stay.
reviews.title: almost wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Fantasctic staff...huge cost....but what a treat great food...super guests..briliant music..full moon... the mermaid pool top ourselves....
reviews.title: A trip back in time to a wonderful elegant period

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I really wanted to like this hotel, but....they didn't make it easy for us. In summary, the hotel is a one off, the rooms are quirky - vintage style rather than modern luxury, but you know all that before you come (although I think the website could be better about giving hard information on the rooms - size and facilities - ours had no shower, only a bath, and it would have been nice to have been warned).
reviews.title: Beyond fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in early October on a mission to find a location for our wedding. The location is perfect, the staff friendly, decor is authentic and the food delicious. There were some issues;
reviews.title: Good but could have been great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had a total of 4/5 hours sleep over 2 nights due to a small (short) and uncomfortable bed.
reviews.title: Like stepping back in ime to a glamourous era!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The dinner dance was fun but food orders came very late. I was asked at gone 10pm if I wanted dessert, at this time I was practically asleep at the table due to the sleep issues the night before.
reviews.title: Amazing location - but staff need to improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: Althought the art deco features are beautiful, they were on occasion impractical, the windows and bed being the main issues. Also the finish to the room was very poor.
reviews.title: "Care or Careless"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pilchard inn is great but excluding non guests from certain parts of the pub is a mistake and resulted in us being insulted by a group of non guests when we left the pub after lunch.
reviews.title: a lovely hotel, shame about the service and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you love Art Deco and the South Devon coast, this is just a great experience, rather than just another hotel.
reviews.title: A 30's treat in a beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (the Gertie Lawrence) was quiet,with comfortable bed, huge roll top bath (no shower) and pleasing 30's furniture and fittings. No TV or tea-making, but a morning tea tray was delivered. And the view back across the sea to the cliffs from our balcony was stunning.
reviews.title: Burgh Island is magical but it comes at a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was excellent,including canapes with the cocktails, dinner and breakfast. All the staff we encountered were cheerfully friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Great location - veggies beware.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its not cheap, but the total experience was "done right" from start to finish, so we left totally satisfied with our visit.
reviews.title: A very Special Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from our third trip to 'BI' - celebrating our 15th anniversary. The setting and aura of the place still exerted their magic and we were sad to leave.
reviews.title: Dreams of Art Deco
